title: Patricia Breen Claude Monet Arrival of the Normandy Train, Gare Saint-Lazare Santa Ornament
description:
Ornament developed from Claude Monet’s Arrival of the Normandy Train, Gare Saint-Lazare, 1877, from the Art Institute of Chicago’s collection.

An icon of modernity at the time, Claude Monet (French, 1840-1926) captured the grand locomotives and puffy clouds of steam at a busy Paris train station in his piece. Now, Patricia Breen adds her touch of artistry with a rendering on this remarkable Santa. Mouth-blown glass is hand-painted and hand-silvered in Krakow, Poland. 

  • Dimensions: 6.49 x 2.75 x 1.77 in.
  • Materials: Glass, Austrian crystals.
  • Hand painted, silvered.
  • Made in Poland.

*Please note: Discounts and promotional pricing do not apply.
